intro: Fischera lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf fischera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in grassland and rocky habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal in garden settings.
